members.name: setModel
members.comment: Sets the model that this button represents.

members.name: init
members.comment: Initializes the menu item with the specified text and icon.

members.name: setUI
members.comment: Sets the look and feel object that renders this component.

values.name: escription
values.value: The UI object that implements the LookAndFeel.

members.name: updateUI
members.comment: Resets the UI property with a value from the current look and feel.

members.name: getUIClassID
members.comment: Returns the suffix used to construct the name of the L&F class used to render this component.

members.name: setArmed
members.comment: Identifies the menu item as "armed". If the mouse button is released while it is over this item, the menu's action event will fire. If the mouse button is released elsewhere, the event will not fire and the menu item will be disarmed.

values.name: escription
values.value: Mouse release will fire an action event

param: b - true to arm the menu item so it can be selected

members.name: isArmed
members.comment: Returns whether the menu item is "armed".

return: true if the menu item is armed, and it can be selected

members.name: setEnabled
members.comment: Enables or disables the menu item.

values.name: escription
values.value: The enabled state of the component.

members.name: setAccelerator
members.comment: Sets the key combination which invokes the menu item's action listeners without navigating the menu hierarchy. It is the UI's responsibility to install the correct action. Note that when the keyboard accelerator is typed, it will work whether or not the menu is currently displayed.

values.name: escription
values.value: The keystroke combination which will invoke the JMenuItem's actionlisteners without navigating the menu hierarchy

param: keyStroke - the KeyStroke which will serve as an accelerator

members.name: getAccelerator
members.comment: Returns the KeyStroke which serves as an accelerator for the menu item.

return: a KeyStroke object identifying the accelerator key

members.name: configurePropertiesFromAction
members.comment: Sets the properties on this button to match those in the specified Action. Refer to Swing Components Supporting Action for more details as to which properties this sets.

param: a - the Action from which to get the properties, or null

members.name: actionPropertyChanged
members.comment: Updates the button's state in response to property changes in the associated action. This method is invoked from the PropertyChangeListener returned from createActionPropertyChangeListener. Subclasses do not normally need to invoke this. Subclasses that support additional Action properties should override this and configurePropertiesFromAction. Refer to the table at Swing Components Supporting Action for a list of the properties this method sets.

param: propertyName - the name of the property that changed

members.name: processMouseEvent
members.comment: Processes a mouse event forwarded from the MenuSelectionManager and changes the menu selection, if necessary, by using the MenuSelectionManager's API. Note: you do not have to forward the event to sub-components. This is done automatically by the MenuSelectionManager.

members.name: processKeyEvent
members.comment: Processes a key event forwarded from the MenuSelectionManager and changes the menu selection, if necessary, by using MenuSelectionManager's API. Note: you do not have to forward the event to sub-components. This is done automatically by the MenuSelectionManager.

members.name: processMenuDragMouseEvent
members.comment: Handles mouse drag in a menu.

members.name: processMenuKeyEvent
members.comment: Handles a keystroke in a menu.

members.name: fireMenuDragMouseEntered
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuDragMouseExited
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuDragMouseDragged
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuDragMouseReleased
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuKeyPressed
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuKeyReleased
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: fireMenuKeyTyped
members.comment: Notifies all listeners that have registered interest for notification on this event type.

members.name: menuSelectionChanged
members.comment: Called by the MenuSelectionManager when the MenuElement is selected or unselected.

param: isIncluded - true if this menu item is on the part of the menu path that changed, false if this menu is part of the a menu path that changed, but this particular part of that path is still the same

members.name: getSubElements
members.comment: This method returns an array containing the sub-menu components for this menu component.

members.name: getComponent
members.comment: Returns the java.awt.Component used to paint this object. The returned component will be used to convert events and detect if an event is inside a menu component.

return: the Component that paints this menu item

members.name: addMenuDragMouseListener
members.comment: Adds a MenuDragMouseListener to the menu item.

members.name: removeMenuDragMouseListener
members.comment: Removes a MenuDragMouseListener from the menu item.

members.name: getMenuDragMouseListeners
members.comment: Returns an array of all the MenuDragMouseListeners added to this JMenuItem with addMenuDragMouseListener().

return: all of the MenuDragMouseListeners added or an empty array if no listeners have been added

members.name: addMenuKeyListener
members.comment: Adds a MenuKeyListener to the menu item.

members.name: removeMenuKeyListener
members.comment: Removes a MenuKeyListener from the menu item.

members.name: getMenuKeyListeners
members.comment: Returns an array of all the MenuKeyListeners added to this JMenuItem with addMenuKeyListener().

return: all of the MenuKeyListeners added or an empty array if no listeners have been added

members.name: paramString
members.comment: Returns a string representation of this JMenuItem. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Returns the AccessibleContext associated with this JMenuItem. For JMenuItems, the AccessibleContext takes the form of an AccessibleJMenuItem. A new AccessibleJMenuItme instance is created if necessary.

return: an AccessibleJMenuItem that serves as the AccessibleContext of this JMenuItem

members.comment: Creates a JMenuItem with no set text or icon.
Creates a JMenuItem with the specified icon.
Creates a JMenuItem with the specified text.
Creates a menu item whose properties are taken from the specified Action.
Creates a JMenuItem with the specified text and icon.
Creates a JMenuItem with the specified text and keyboard mnemonic.

name: javax.swing.JMenuItem
comment:
An implementation of an item in a menu. A menu item is essentially a button sitting in a list. When the user selects the "button", the action associated with the menu item is performed. A JMenuItem contained in a JPopupMenu performs exactly that function.

Menu items can be configured, and to some degree controlled, by Actions. Using an Action with a menu item has many benefits beyond directly configuring a menu item. Refer to Swing Components Supporting Action for more details, and you can find more information in How to Use Actions, a section in The Java Tutorial.

For further documentation and for examples, see How to Use Menus in The Java Tutorial.

Warning: Swing is not thread safe. For more information see Swing's Threading Policy.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeans has been added to the java.beans package. Please see XMLEncoder.

see: JPopupMenu, JMenu, JCheckBoxMenuItem, JRadioButtonMenuItem
